title: Secret area in final level of Keen6
content:
Ok, you know in the very first room of the Bloog Control Center there's a hidden area up at the very top of the room with tons of points and lives and stuff? (look at the level map at KeenWiki if you don't know what I'm talking about) Is there any way to get up there without using the Impossible Bullet trick?"A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Re: Secret area in final level of Keen6
content: I somehow recall it having to do with that door in the end room containing Molly, though it's been a fair while since I played that level thoroughly.

title: Secret
content:
You see that switch right at the start of the level? Follow the pole straight down. Yes, there's glowy spike balls of death on either side... but save your game, and give it a shot--you'll have to be further to the right than you think, but it'll work eventually. After you fall off the bottom of the screen, press "up" as if you were going to enter a door--poof! You're up where the points are.

Wouldn't be worth it without the Save-and-Reload option. Waaaaay too risky.

title: Re: Secret
content:
Oh no, you can get it done real easy with a smidgen of practice.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Secret
content:
God mode, fall to the flares bottom, press "enter door" key. Enjoy.------------------------------

title: Re: The Simple Lie
content:
I forgot that one. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I'm also pretty sure you can fall in the flares bottom without god mode if you fall in such a way you get right in the middle of the two flares near the switch's pole. I have been trying to do that for years, though, with no positive results.

I can recall CK Guy using a similar trick in one of his Keen5 levels.------------------------------

title: Pogo Perfection
content:
Well, the pogo sprites have clipping rectangles exactly 16 pixels wide... so in theory it's possible to pogo down there if your trajectory is absolutely pixel-perfect. It'd be so much easier if you could cling to a ledge while free-falling--that sprite is only 10 pixels wide!

I couldn't even get the position right by standing on the bottom with God Mode on, turning on the pogo and then turning God Mode off.

title: Re: It can be done!
content:
I tried it, and did it on my first try. But now I can't do it again... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Gotta love it when that happens.
content:
Hahaha. As soon as I saw that, it occurred to me the purpose of that lift above. Its right edge is perfectly aligned with the gap, so all you need to do is jump onto it and quickly walk one pixel off the right.

So I killed myself to try again. Jumped onto the lift and made it into the gap on my first try.

title: Re: Gotta love it when that happens.
content:
Holy crap, it works! Spiffy!

I think that gets the award for "most obscure secret in the Keen series"."A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Or...
content: You could always Impossible Bullet up there...

content:
